p: The sample area has a humid continental climate, with an average annual temperature of 10.5 °C and an average annual precipitation of 550 mm. Agriculture is facing major challenges as a result of its more and more arid climate, which is characterized by diminishing summer rainfall, increasing drought frequency, and the significant decline in groundwater level (up to 6–8 m in some areas) since 1970 [ 16, 29, 33, 34]. Since the 1990s, the main land use changes of these areas have been arable land abandonment and the conversion of grassland to plantation. The abandonment of arable land was most significant in sandy areas, which are very sensitive to drought and have poor water retention capabilities [ 16, 29, 33, 34].
